summary: This bill, the "Stopping Tariffs on Allies and Bolstering Legislative Exercise of Trade Policy Act" (STABLE Trade Policy Act), aims to limit the President's authority to impose new or increased tariffs on goods imported from U.S. allies and free trade agreement partners. It requires the President to submit a request to Congress justifying the tariff and obtain approval via a joint resolution before implementing such tariffs. The bill defines covered countries and duties, outlining the process for congressional review and approval.
